qas.question: What is the name of the first public-access TV channel in the country?
In what year did the Manhattan Neighborhood Network begin?
What is the primary public television station in New York?
What is the largest public radio station in the US by audience size?
In what year did the city cease to own WNYC?
The public-assess TV channel that has been around the longest in the US in what?
When was the Manhattan Neighborhood Network created?
The largest public radio station by listeners is what in New York?

context: New York is also a major center for non-commercial educational media. The oldest public-access television channel in the United States is the <a0_0><a5_0>Manhattan Neighborhood Network<a5_0/><a0_0/>, founded in <a1_0><a6_0>1971<a6_0/><a1_0/>. <a2_0>WNET<a2_0/> is the city's major public television station and a primary source of national Public Broadcasting Service (PBS) television programming. <a3_0><a7_0>WNYC<a7_0/><a3_0/>, a public radio station owned by the city until <a4_0>1997<a4_0/>, has the largest public radio audience in the United States.
